abstract: Temasek, Singapore’s investment fund, defended its money-losing exit from Bank of America, saying the United States-centric bank did not fit its investment criteria and the risk was perceived to be greater than the expected return.
snippet: Temasek, Singapore’s investment fund, defended its money-losing exit from Bank of America, saying the United States-centric bank did not fit its investment criteria and the risk was perceived to be greater than the expected return.
lead_paragraph: Temasek, Singapore’s investment fund, defended its money-losing exit from Bank of America, saying the United States-based bank did not fit its investment criteria and the risk was perceived to be greater than the expected return, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Singapore’s Temasek Defends Costly BofA Exit
